EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
			 
Item:  8.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
						 
						 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
						 
						 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Gail Beal, Senior Vice President from Keenan Financial Services
						 
						 
SUBJECT:
Presentation/Discussion regarding Supplemental Employee Retirement Plan (SERP)
			 
			 
The attached presentation provides a review and analysis of findings for the Supplemental Employee Retirement Plan that was offered to Certificated non-management employees.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
			 
Item:  8.02
TO:
Board of Trustees
						 
						 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
						 
						 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services
						 
						 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Amended Resolution #2011/2012-08A Supplemental Employee Retirement Plan (SERP) for Certificated Non-Management Employees
			 
			 
DISCLOSURE OF POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST
The subject matter of this Agenda item (Supplemental Early Retirement Plan (SERP)) raises a potential conflict of interest insofar as the eligibility criteria developed by Keenan and Associates could result in a monetary benefit to the spouse of Superintendent Dan Moser. For that reason, and upon the guidance and advice of the District’s Legal Counsel, the Superintendent has recused himself and will recuse himself from the Board discussion and consideration of this matter and will recuse himself from any involvement in the creation and administration of the SERP if it is approved by the Board in its current proposed form or as it may be amended or modified.
			 
			*******************************************
			 
This resolution will enable the District to offer an incentive to Certificated Non-Management employees to retire effective June 30, 2012.  There were a total of 77 certificated non-management employees who decided to retire now.  The average age for all retirees is 62.5 years and their average years of service is 29.6 years.  Employees were required to meet certain eligibility requirements as stated in the resolution in order to participate in the plan.  The cost of the incentive is offset by the savings realized by reducing positions and/or filling positions at a lower salary.
			 
			 
			 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Net Savings of $2.4 million over 5 years
			 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund-Benefits
			 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt amended resolution 2011/2012-08A Supplemental Employee Retirement Plan (SERP) for Certificated Non-Management Employees.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
			 
Item:  8.03
			 
Amended
TO:
Board of Trustees
						 
						 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
						 
						 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services
						 
						 
SUBJECT:
Presentation, Discussion and/or Action regarding ESUHSD Budget Status Outlook
			 
			 
The attached 2012-13 Budget Status Outlook provides an in-depth analysis of how the State budget actions have impacted the East Side Union High School District since FY 2007-08. The budget outlook examines how the district has responded to State budget actions and reviews the fiscal and budgetary challenges that are expected to impact the district over the short and long-term.  The budget outlook analyzes the Governor’s budget for FY 2012-13 and provides budget contingency recommendations in order to ensure that the district is prepared in the event the Governor’s tax measure fails.  Finally, the budget outlook will look at some of the opportunities that may be available to the district in order to generate additional revenues and reduce expenses.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  8.05 
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Extension of Contract for Substitute Director of Construction/Facilities
	 
	 
	 
Administration requests that the Board approve a 40-day extension of the contract for Thomas J. Herrington as "Substitute Director of Construction/Facilities."
	 
Mr. Herrington was initially employed in the Substitute Director position effective as of July 25, 2011, for a period of 90 days.  At the October 20, 2011, Board Meeting the Board approved a 90-day extension of his contract which expired on January 21, 2012, and, thereafter, at the Board meeting of January 19, 2012, the Board approved a 30-day extension of Mr. Herrington's contract.  
	 
Mr. Herrington is providing critical support in connection with the District’s Measure E and Measure G Bond Programs and the District’s Facilities department and the District has an ongoing need for his services for an additional 40 days.
	 
	 
Fiscal Impact:
$419.75 per eight (8) hour day
	 
Funding Source:
Measure G and Measure E
	 
Recommendation: 
Administration recommends that the Board approve a 40-day extension of the contract for Thomas J. Herrington as "Substitute Director of Construction/Facilities” in the form attached and at the same compensation rate as previously approved.
